compliancy.name: UNIX STIG
compliancy.title: U.S. DISA Security Technical Implementation Guides - Unix System Readiness Review (SRR) Checks

abstract.para: The Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs) are the configuration standards for U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) Information Assurance (IA) and IA-enabled devices/systems. The guides are maintained and published by the Defense Information Systems Agencyâ€™s (DISA) Field Security Office (FSO).
Note that the SRRs have been deprecated by DISA.

line-item.description: TCB Software

line-item.description: securetcpip Command

line-item.description: System Baseline for Files with TCB Bit Set

line-item.name: AIX00080
line-item.description: SYSTEM Attribute

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX001431
line-item.description: The /etc/gshadow file must be owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX001432
line-item.description: The /etc/gshadow file must be group-owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX001433
line-item.description: The /etc/gshadow file must have mode 0400.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX001434
line-item.description: The /etc/gshadow file must not have an extended ACL.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00240
line-item.description: The ext3 filesystem type must be used for the primary Linux file system partitions.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00320
line-item.description: The system must not have special privilege accounts, such as shutdown and halt.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00360
line-item.description: The X server must have the correct options enabled.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00380
line-item.description: An X server must have none of the following options enabled: -ac, -core (except for debugging purposes), or -nolock.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00400
line-item.description: The /etc/security/access.conf file must be owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00420
line-item.description: The /etc/security/access.conf file must have a privileged group owner.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00440
line-item.description: The /etc/security/access.conf file must have mode 0640 or less permissive.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00450
line-item.description: The /etc/security/access.conf file must not have an extended ACL.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00480
line-item.description: The /etc/sysctl.conf file must be owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00500
line-item.description: The /etc/sysctl.conf file must be group-owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00520
line-item.description: The /etc/sysctl.conf file must have mode 0600 or less permissive.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00530
line-item.description: The /etc/sysctl.conf file must not have an extended ACL.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00560
line-item.description: The Linux NFS Server must not have the insecure file locking option.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00580
line-item.description: The x86 CTRL-ALT-DELETE key sequence must be disabled.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00600
line-item.description: The Linux PAM system must not grant sole access to admin privileges to the first user who logs into the console.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00620
line-item.description: The /etc/securetty file must be group-owned by root, sys, or bin.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00640
line-item.description: The /etc/securetty file must be owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00660
line-item.description: The /etc/securetty file must have mode 0640 or less permissive.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00720
line-item.description: Auditing must be enabled at boot by setting a kernel parameter.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX007580
line-item.description: The PF_LLC protocol handler must not be bound to the network stack.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX007600
line-item.description: The PF_LLC protocol handler must be prevented from dynamic loading.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX007620
line-item.description: The PF_LLC protocol handler must not be installed.

line-item.name: GEN000000-LNX00800
line-item.description: The system must use a Linux Security Module that is configured to limit the privileges of system services.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00020
line-item.description: The nosuid option must be configured in the /etc/rmmount.conf file.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00040
line-item.description: The /etc/security/audit_user file must not define a different auditing level for specific users.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00060
line-item.description: The /etc/security/audit_user file must be owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00080
line-item.description: The /etc/security/audit_user file must be group-owned by root, sys, or bin.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00100
line-item.description: The /etc/security/audit_user file must have mode 0640 or less permissive.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00110
line-item.description: The /etc/security/audit_user file must not have an extended ACL.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00120
line-item.description: The ASET master files must be located in the /usr/aset/masters directory.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00140
line-item.description: The /usr/aset/masters/uid_aliases must be empty.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00160
line-item.description: If the system is a firewall, ASET must be used on the system, and the firewall parameters must be set in /usr/aset/asetenv.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00180
line-item.description: The Solaris system Automated Security Enhancement Tool (ASET) configurable parameters in the asetenv file must be correct.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00200
line-item.description: If NIS+ is configured on the Solaris system, YPCHECK must be set to true.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00220
line-item.description: The /usr/aset/userlist file must exist.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00240
line-item.description: The /usr/aset/userlist file must be owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00250
line-item.description: The /usr/aset/userlist file must be group-owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00260
line-item.description: The /usr/aset/userlist file must have mode 0600 or less permissive.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00270
line-item.description: The /usr/aset/userlist file must not have an extended ACL.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00300
line-item.description: The Solaris system EEPROM security-mode parameter must be set to full or command mode.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00400
line-item.description: The NFS server must have logging implemented.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00420
line-item.description: Hidden extended file attributes must not exist on the system.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00440
line-item.description: The root account must be the only account with GID of 0.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00540
line-item.description: The /etc/zones directory, and its contents, must be owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00560
line-item.description: The /etc/zones directory, and its contents, must be group-owned by sys.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00580
line-item.description: The /etc/zones directory, and its contents, must have mode 0755 or less permissive.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00600
line-item.description: The /etc/zones directory, and its contents, must not have an extended ACL.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00620
line-item.description: The inherit-pkg-dir zone option must be set to none or the system default list defined for sparse root zones.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00640
line-item.description: The limitpriv zone option must be set to the vendor default or less permissive.

line-item.name: GEN000000-SOL00660
line-item.description: The physical devices must not assigned to non-global zones.

line-item.name: GEN000240
line-item.description: Network Time-Server

line-item.name: GEN000241
line-item.description: The system clock must be synchronized continuously, or at least daily.

line-item.name: GEN000242
line-item.description: The system must use at least two time sources for clock synchronization.

line-item.name: GEN000244
line-item.description: The system must use time sources that are local to the enclave.

line-item.name: GEN000246
line-item.description: The system time synchronization method must use cryptographic algorithms to verify the authenticity and integrity of the time data.

line-item.name: GEN000250
line-item.description: The time synchronization configuration file (such as /etc/ntp.conf) must be owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN000251
line-item.description: The time synchronization configuration file (such as /etc/ntp.conf) must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or system.

line-item.name: GEN000252
line-item.description: The time synchronization configuration file (such as /etc/ntp.conf) must have mode 0640 or less permissive.

line-item.name: GEN000253
line-item.description: The time synchronization configuration file (such as /etc/ntp.conf) must not have an extended ACL.

line-item.name: GEN000585
line-item.description: The system must enforce the correctness of the entire password during authentication.

line-item.name: GEN000588
line-item.description: The system must use a FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic module (operating in FIPS mode) for generating system password hashes.

line-item.description: The 'ldd' command must be disabled unless it protects against the execution of untrusted files.

line-item.name: GEN007970
line-item.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the system must use a FIPS 140-2 validated cryptographic module (operating in FIPS mode) for protecting the LDAP connection.

line-item.name: GEN008000
line-item.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, certificates used to authenticate to the LDAP server must be provided from DoD PKI or a DoD-approved external PKI.

line-item.name: GEN008020
line-item.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the LDAP TLS connection must require that the server provides a certificate and that this certificate has a valid trust path to a trusted CA.

line-item.name: GEN008040
line-item.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the system must check that the LDAP server's certificate has not been revoked.

line-item.name: GEN008050
line-item.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the /etc/ldap.conf file (or equivalent) must not contain passwords.

line-item.name: GEN008060
line-item.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information the /etc/ldap.conf (or equivalent) file must have mode 0644 or less permissive.

line-item.name: GEN008080
line-item.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the /etc/ldap.conf (or equivalent) file must be owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN008100
line-item.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the /etc/ldap.conf (or equivalent) file must be group-owned by root, bin, sys, or system.

line-item.name: GEN008120
line-item.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the /etc/ldap.conf (or equivalent) file must not have an extended ACL.

line-item.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the TLS certificate authority file and/or directory (as appropriate) must be owned by root.

line-item.name: GEN008160

line-item.name: GEN008180
line-item.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the TLS certificate authority file and/or directory (as appropriate) must have mode 0644 (0755 for directories) or less permissive.

line-item.name: GEN008200
line-item.description: If the system is using LDAP for authentication or account information, the LDAP TLS certificate authority file and/or directory (as appropriate) must not have an extended ACL.

line-item.name: GEN008280
